莌字的基本解释

莌
tuō
通脱木，即通草，一种药材，为灌木或小乔木，茎髓入药。

莌字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tuō］
［《廣韻》他括切，入末，透。］
见“活莌”。

莌字的康熙字典解释

【申集上】【艸字部】　莌； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1033第30
【唐韻】徒活切，音奪。【爾雅·釋草】離南，活莌。【疏】離南，一名活莌。【山海經】又名?脫。郭註：生江南，高丈許，零陵人植而日灌之，以爲樹。【廣韻】活莌，大葉，莖中有瓤，正白。

考證：〔【山海經】又名?脫，生江南。〕　謹照原文寇脱下增郭註二字。
莌字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
莌字的起名意思

暂无。

Sul
Basic explanation of words
Sul
tuō
Tongtuomu, namely Tongcao, a kind of medicinal material, is a shrub or small tree whose stem is used as medicine.

[①] [tuō]
["Guangyun" He includes cutting, entering the end, and thorough. ]

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji 1] [Department of Zong Zi] 　莌; Kangxi strokes: 13; Page number: page 1033 to 30
[Tang Yun] Lively and lively, and the sound is dazzling. [Erya Shicao] Li Nan, lively. [Sparse] Li Nan, a lively girl. [Shan Hai Jing] also known as "Take off". Guo's Note: Born in the south of the Yangtze River, Gao Zhangxu, people in Lingling plant and irrigate it every day, thinking of trees. [Guangyun] Lively sage, big leaves, fleshy stems, and white. Textual research: [[Shanhaijing], also known as? Tuo, was born in Jiangnan. 〕 　 I would like to take off Zeng Guo’s note based on the original text.
